meanings.definition: The act of organizing or controlling something strictly and systematically.
meanings.sent1: The regimentation of the school schedule ensures that everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The military relies on regimentation to maintain order and discipline among the troops.
meanings.sent3: The strict regimentation of the ants' daily tasks led to a comical mix-up in their colony.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the traffic lights act as a form of regimentation, guiding the flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The regimentation of the factory assembly line made production efficient and precise.

meanings.definition: The process of imposing order or discipline on a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: Regimentation in the workplace helps ensure that tasks are completed on time.
meanings.sent2: During boot camp, new recruits experience the regimentation of military training.
meanings.sent3: The regimentation of the penguins' daily swim schedule led to a hilarious mix-up at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The strict regimentation of the conductor kept the orchestra in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The coach's regimentation of the team's practice routine improved their performance on the field.
